title: (x) Fonts with round capital O's (Link inside) / Geometric sans - modified Futura, suggestions {Tamas, Marc O}
content:
Hello,

I've lurked here for a looong time and finally decided to set-up my account. I'm looking for fonts that have round O's and "stiff" capitals as seen in the logo of [http://www.fhoke.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150301011612/http:/www.fhoke.com/ "http://www.fhoke.com").

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150301011612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logoFhoke_5531.gif)

I've been scouring my small collection and MyFonts for a bit and I can't seem to find any. Suggestions? Thanks! FF

P.S I know the correct term is not "stiff", what kind of font is that considered?
author: font fanatic

comments.content:
That's probably [Futura Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150301011612/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/futura/bold/), with the F and E customized.

Is 'geometric' the term you are looking for?
Why thank you good sir! That does seem to fit the bill! I appreciate the help! I also agree that geometric is the proper term that I am looking for!
Gotham is a beautiful font with a round "O" and geometric letters.

For an art deco feel, try Kabel...  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/search/kabel/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150301011612/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/kabel/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/kabel/fonts/")

... or Mark Simonson's Mostra Nuova  
 [http://www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostranuova.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150301011612/http:/www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostranuova.html "http://www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostranuova.html")

For a nod to the 60s/70s, try Avant Garde or its slab-serif sibling, Lubalin Graph:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/search/avant+garde/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150301011612/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/avant+garde/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/avant+garde/fonts/")

...or search MyFonts or FontShop for "geometric."

thank you for all the help everyone. Very helpful! I appreciate it very much!

FF
